data.title: University of the East Ramon Magsaysay Philippines 2024
data.meta_description: The University of the East Ramon Magsaysay Philippines 2024-25: Admission, Course, Fee Structure, Ranking, Hostel, Eligibility, FAQs etc.
data.text:
The University of the East Ramon Magsaysay Philippines was founded in 1956. In June of the same year, the UERM Memorial Medical Center was renamed the “University of the East Ramon Magsaysay Memorial Medical Center” in honour of President Ramon Magsaysay Sr., who tragically passed away in a plane crash just a few months prior. Renowned for its excellence in medical education, it stands as one of the premier colleges for MBBS in the Philippines.

[Page Index]

College Summary

Before we go through the detailed information about the University of the East Ramon Magsaysay , let’s examine the college’s essential details.

Affiliation and Recognition

The University of the East Ramon Magsaysay is one of the biggest medical universities in Philippines, and it is affiliated with and recognized by various Medical Councils such as:

National Medical Commission of India (NMC).

World Health Organization (WHO).

Courses Offered

University of the East Ramon Magsaysay MBBS courses offer quality medical programs under highly qualified faculty and state-of-the-art infrastructure. This University in the Philippines is famous for its medical programs (MBBS).

Admission Procedure

If you want to take University of the East Ramon Magsaysay admission in 2024, you must qualify for the National Eligibility Entrance Exam (NEET) for Indian students.

Eligibility Criteria

The Philippines has become one of the top favourite destinations for Indian and international students who want to pursue their medical degree courses abroad. So, if you’re going to study MBBS at University of the East Ramon Magsaysay, check the eligibility criteria below.

Graphical Representation of Eligibility Criteria

Document Required

Before applying for admission, please do not forget to bring all these related documents.

Passport (Minimum 18 months validity).

Class 10th Passing Certificate & Mark sheet.

Class 12th Passing Certificate & Mark sheet.

Birth Certificate.

Ten passport-size Photographs

Official Invitation letter from the Medical University of the Philippines.

Authorization of all documents from the Ministry of External Affairs, New Delhi.

Legalization of all documents from the Philippines Embassy.

Visa fees.

Bank receipt of 1st Year Tuition fee (required for some Universities).

Medical test documents.

About Quezon City

Quezon City is a highly urbanized city located in the National Capital Region (NCR) of the Philippines. Here’s an overview of Quezon City:

History: Quezon City was founded and named after Manuel L. Quezon, the second President of the Philippines. It served as the country’s capital from 1948 to 1976 before Manila reassumed its status as the capital.

Population: It is one of the most populated cities in the Philippines and serves as a hub for commerce, education, government, and entertainment.

Economy: Quezon City has a diverse economy with sectors including retail, services, manufacturing, and information technology. It has several business districts, shopping centres, and commercial establishments.

Education: The city is known for its numerous educational institutions, including universities, colleges, and schools offering various academic programs.

University of the East Ramon Magsaysay

Address: Aurora Boulevard, Quezon City, Philippines, 1113

Official Website: https://uerm.edu.ph/#/
